message.content:
cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI. 

The paper discusses the use of deep learning architectures for speech recognition, which falls under the sub-category of natural language processing (NLP) in computer science. Specifically, the paper focuses on the use of auditory-based Gabor features, which are a type of signal processing technique used in speech recognition. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SD (sound), followed by cs.CL (computation and language), as the paper discusses the use of deep learning architectures for speech recognition. Additionally, the paper proposes a measure of phoneme similarity, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.LG (learning) or cs.NE (neural and evolutionary computing). Finally, the paper also discusses the use of spectro-temporal Gabor features, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.AI (artificial intelligence).
